meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a cloister.
meanings.sent1: The quiet, cloistral garden provided a peaceful retreat for meditation.
meanings.sent2: The nuns lived a cloistral life within the monastery walls.
meanings.sent3: The cloistral atmosphere of the library made it the perfect place to study in peace.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a cloistral sanctuary, untouched by the chaos of the outside world.
meanings.sent5: The cloistral aura of the ancient church enveloped visitors in a sense of tranquility.
